parameters: \pop[2]As soon as I enter Taylor's house, I'm taken aback.
\pop[2]It's a night and day difference when I compare it to Isaac's.
\pop[2]You can tell that he's on the cutting edge. Everything is so "modern".
\pop[2]But I guess it had to be. I'd imagine a streamer needs to stay current.
\pop[2]There must be all sorts of trends in the field; just like any other.
\pop[2]Whatever he was doing though, he was doing it right.
\pop[2]It's nice to be somewhere other than the Triple R, though.
\pop[2]All of my other meetings and outings seem to revolve around that place.
\pop[2]But here I was, in Taylor's home. Just like we planned at the nightclub.
This is my castle. My pride and joy.
And even better, I made it with no middle-man.
\i[5]"It's incredible. I'm really happy for you, Taylor."
\i[2]"Yeah. Because \c[14]you\c[0] like being the one in the middle."
\i[6]"This is it...? I thought you were like, super successful."
\i[0]"It's kind of extra. You went way too overboard."
\i[5]"It's incredible. I'm really happy for you, Taylor."
A lot of people think I went overboard.
But I need a good set for all of my streams, too.
\pop[3]Believe it or not, I don't just game all the time.
A lot of my streams take place around the house.
Even did some archery in the backyard last week.
\i[2]"Yeah. Because \c[14]you\c[0] like being the one in the middle."
Why not settle for the best of both worlds, right?
A little bit of each is clearly the best way to go.
\pop[3]And if you're lucky, maybe I'll let you take part.
I hope my intentions were clear enough when I invited you over.
Been eyeing you since day one, and I'd like to think you took notice.
\i[6]"This is it...? I thought you were like, super successful."
\pop[3]Didn't realize my snark was rubbing off on you.
Trust me, Delta; I can sense sarcasm better than \c[14]anybody\c[0].
It's something you pick up when you spend time with Dante.
\pop[3]But I have to say, you're getting pretty good at it.
If I didn't have some self-confidence, I'd probably be hurt.
You gotta build a thick skin when you have a chat full of randoms.
\i[0]"It's kind of extra. You went way too overboard."
\pop[3]Life's no fun if you're not going overboard, though!
When I \c[10]die\c[0], I want to know that I lived my life to the fullest.
No regrets. I think that's the sign of a life well-lived.
\pop[3]You're not alone, though. People say I go overboard all the time.
Thankfully, my chat is super loyal, and they've always got my back.
I'd only start to worry if \c[14]they\c[0] had something to say about it.
\pop[2]He smiles at me, before quickly changing the subject.
\pop[2]Pointing to the table, I notice two plates of food.
\pop[2]I was actually starving, so I appreciate it.
So what do you say? Wanna take a seat?
\pop[2]I nod, and we move to the couch.
\pop[2]I look down at the plate, and I'm not sure what I see.
\pop[2]Whatever a "Taylor Special" was, it was certainly unique.
Your favorite chicken sandwich, \c[14]smothered\c[0] in honey dill sauce.
And if you're so inclined, a slice of provolone to top it all off.
\pop[2]I stare at him with a blank expression, then shrug.
\pop[3]Anyway, it's best if the bun is brioche.
And the sauce is mayo, honey, and dried dill.
\pop[2]Why is he listing the ingredients like I'm on some sort of cooking show?
\pop[3]Well, you never know how many people are watching.
Might as well let them know how to make it themselves, right?
\pop[2]He starts to eat, almost comically fast, like a cartoon character.
\pop[2]This seems extremely unhealthy, but also kind of delicious.
\pop[2]With his size, I doubt he eats like this too often.
\pop[2]This must be special to him, so I decide to follow suit.
\pop[2]It's the best thing I've ever tasted in my life.
\pop[2]The sweet and savory sauce, with a hint of dill.
\pop[2]The sharpness of the provolone, the crunch of the fried chicken.
\pop[2]It's a symphony of flavors, in perfect harmony with one another.
\pop[2]And he's right, the brioche bun really brings it all together.
\pop[3]Save this one for special occasions, Delta.
You don't want to wear it out. Trust me.
\pop[2]I'm surprised that I've never heard of this sauce before.
\pop[3]It's actually a well-kept secret from where I used to live.
Remember how I said I used to move around all the time?
Every province has its own "thing", so I have a lot of fun recipes.
I'm a little sad that I stopped moving around, actually.
Discovering regional things like this was always so much fun.
\pop[2]Yeah, he did say he moved around a lot.
\pop[2]I ask him if he's comfortable elaborating, and he smiles.
\pop[2]It doesn't appear to be a touchy subject, which is nice.
\pop[3]Well, I told you that \c[23]The System\c[0] always kept me mobile, right?
I was always in a foster home, or a group home of some sort. Depressing stuff.
Kept causing fights, and getting into trouble, so they kept moving me around.
Like there was some magical place that'd change my life.
Little did I know, it was Toronto. But not because of the city. It was my friends.
\pop[2]I guess it makes sense, when I actually stop to think about it.
\pop[2]I vaguely remember talk about how Taylor was a "jerk for fun" in the past.
\pop[2]But the implications of foster homes and group homes worried me.
\pop[2]That one definitely seemed like a touchy subject, so I avoid it.
\pop[2]I'm just happy that he finally found his calling, and place in life.
\pop[2]After we finish eating, he turns to face me while sitting down.
\pop[2]I do the same, and we share an awkward smile.
\pop[3]I'm sure you can understand. You've changed since you got here, too.
We're better together than we ever were apart, and it's a beautiful thing.
Can't believe I used to push people away instead of embracing them.
\pop[3]That would've made my vision come to pass, for sure.
Got a little tired of that thing having power over me.
It wasn't really substantial, but it still kinda sucked.
\pop[2]This is the first time he's mentioned it, if I recall correctly.
\pop[2]I tell him not to elaborate unless he's comfortable enough to do so.
\pop[3]Oh, it's really nothing. In fact, it almost feels abstract.
I can't see anything at all. It's almost like - complete darkness.
All I know is that I feel lost and alone. Knowing there's no one that cares.
\pop[3]And that's it. I just... jolt back into consciousness.
A pretty stupid vision if you ask me. It's not useful at all.
I beat it, too. I know that was the \c[14]old\c[0] me. Not \c[14]this\c[0] version.
\pop[3]If I kept pushing people away, then I'd end up alone for sure.
But now I have the best friends in the world, \c[14]and\c[0] the best fans.
I guess mine was kind of like a wake up call. But that's pretty normal.
\pop[3]I'm far from the first guy who's made some changes due to their vision.
Sometimes I just wish there was a little more to it, you know?
Some grand destiny to seize, or some extravagant life.
\pop[2]I tell him that he already has that on his own. No vision required.
\pop[2]He has one of the highest sub counts in the world, and kills every stream.
\pop[3]Heh. I guess it makes sense when you put it like that.
From the outside looking in, I guess it must seem pretty impressive.
But when you live it, every day is just like the last. It can lose some meaning.
\pop[3]Even people at the top of the world are chasing their next big thrill.
The things we dream of having can just fade away in the face of our next big goal.
It's why I like to keep my life fresh and exciting. So nothing gets "boring" over time.
\pop[2]From what he's said, he enjoys having multiple sexual and romantic partners.
\pop[2]All of a sudden, that lifestyle seems a bit like an act to defy his vision.
\pop[2]If he was always with someone when the lights were out, then he'd never be by himself.
\pop[2]The nervous smirk he gives me at that exact moment only enforces my thoughts.
\pop[2]Always joking about how the whole group should date? I understand it even more.
\pop[2]He just doesn't want to be alone...
\pop[3]Anyway, I didn't mean to get all introspective.
I actually just invited you over for some fun. Like, "fun", fun.
It probably sounds shallow, but it's been on my mind since we met.
\pop[3]However, after getting to know you, I've changed my mind.
So an arrangement like that isn't something I'd just jump into.
I value your friendship, Delta. But I'm open to some benefits.
\pop[2]This is all so "on-brand" for Taylor, that I'm not even surprised.
\pop[2]This is the guy that flirted with me the second after meeting me.
\pop[2]With everything he's said, I figured he was after this all along.
\pop[2]And I know Isaac would be fine with it, even if we're dating.
\pop[2]He even said so back on our first date at the Triple R, just to set the standard.
\pop[2]But I'm getting ahead of myself here. I should answer Taylor's question.
\pop[2]Friends with benefits? And possibly the option for something more?
\pop[2]But I'm still getting a little ahead of myself here.
\pop[2]I should still answer Taylor, since he's staring right at me.
\pop[2]Friends with benefits? And maybe the option for something more...?
\pop[3]What do you say, Delta? No strings attached.
But \c[14]rope\c[0]? Now that's a different story~
\i[2]"Sure, I'm down to give it a shot."
\i[5]"I think we should stay friends, Taylor."
\i[2]"Sure, I'm down to give it a shot."
\pop[3]Glad to hear it! Really, I am.
But just so you know, I didn't want to do it right \c[14]now\c[0].
This was just to break the ice, and share a special meal.
\pop[3]I want our friendship to be just as important as anything else we do.
But New Year's Eve is coming up, and that's always a romantic night.
Go out with the others, and you'll have a date for every midnight~
\i[5]"I think we should stay friends, Taylor."
\pop[3]Oh. That's totally fine with me. I wasn't trying to pressure you at all.
It's part of why I invited you over here for a meal, more than anything else.
\pop[3]I wanted you to know that I value your friendship, and I don't need to pursue more.
It was tempting, and I thought I'd shoot my shot, but missing doesn't bother me.
Might be hard to turn off my flirting, though. But it's all in good fun, yeah?
\pop[2]He gives me a soft smile, like he's more comfortable all of a sudden.
\pop[2]I guess if he was thinking of this since we first met, it's been on his mind a lot.
\pop[3]I'm glad we could clear the air, and figure out what's going on.
How about we just relax now, and enjoy each other's company?
I could show you some of my big career highlights, too.
\pop[2]I smile at him, and tell him that I'd love to do that.
\pop[2]It's important to learn about the content my friends create.
\pop[2]If we all supported each other, there's nothing we couldn't do.
\pop[2]I'm also grateful that he didn't want to rush into anything.
\pop[2]I value his friendship as well, so it didn't make sense to jump right into that stuff.
\pop[2]It's nice to know that I was valued in return. I'm definitely closer to him than before.
\pop[2]And because of that I'm sure he'd find a future that's truly free from the darkness.
